---
status: public
shortDescription: "The body of an if-statement executes repeatedly, as long as the condition holds"
shortCorrection: "The body of an if-statement executes at most once"
concepts:
  - Conditional
  - Loop
  - ControlFlow
related:
  # - id: LiteralNoExpression
  #   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
  - pl: Java
    id: IfIsLoop
  # - pl: Python
  #   id: NoAtomicExpression
spec:
  - id: plr3.13
    sections: ["7.0"]
expressibleInNms:
  - id: ControlFlowAsGraph
    how: graph of if statement
plVersion:
  # from: ecma6
  # to: ecma11
observed: "research"
pytamaroActivityVersion: v1
references:
  - citationKey: chiodiniSurveyingUpperSecondaryTeachers2025
    phenomena: [IIL]
---

The body of the `if`-statement executes as many times as needed
to ensure the condition does not hold anymore and execution can continue.

frontmatter.shortDescription: The body of an if-statement executes repeatedly, as long as the condition holds
frontmatter.shortCorrection: The body of an if-statement executes at most once
